KH.content: w/ no essence, how could khōra be beyond its name? it anachronizes being, and it is like nothing, there beyond its name
KH.linkedContent: w/ no essence, how could khōra be beyond its name? it anachronizes being, and it is like nothing, there beyond its name

KH.content: es gibt always implicated in negative theology (in its Christian history?); what there is, there, is not; p. 97 there is khōra, but the khōra does not exist [importance of article]
KH.linkedContent: es gibt always implicated in negative theology (in its Christian history?); what there is, there, is not; p. 97 there is khōra, but the khōra does not exist [importance of article]

GT.content: “there is gift,” not the same as “the gift exists”  [ontological difference?]
GT.linkedContent: “there is gift,” not the same as “the gift exists” [ontological difference?]

GT.content: gap (écart) btwn thought, language and desire & philosophy, knowledge and science does not exist, gap btwn gift & economy: resembles an empty word or transcendental illusion
GT.linkedContent: gap (écart) btwn thought, language and desire & philosophy, knowledge and science does not exist, gap btwn gift & economy: resembles an empty word or transcendental illusion

GT.content: perhaps analogy to Kant’s noumenal & phenomenal will help us
GT.linkedContent: perhaps analogy to Kant’s noumenal & phenomenal will help us

GT.content: la différance, qui n’(est) rien, est (dans) la chose même, elle est (donnée) dans la chose même, elle (est) la chose même, elle, la différance, la chose (même), elle, sans rien d’autre, elle-même, rien [differance, the nothing in the thing-itself]
GT.linkedContent: la différance, qui n’(est) rien, est (dans) la chose même, elle est (donnée) dans la chose même, elle (est) la chose même, elle, la différance, la chose (même), elle, sans rien d’autre, elle-même, rien [differance, the nothing in the thing-itself]

MONL.content: fatal precipitation of promise dissociated from will, intention, meaning-to-say [vouloir-dire], heralds uniqueness of language to came, “there is…” implies “it doesn’t exist”
MONL.linkedContent: fatal precipitation of promise dissociated from will, intention, meaning-to-say [vouloir-dire], heralds uniqueness of language to came, “there is…” implies “it doesn’t exist”

MONL.content: Heidegger says [?], “there is language that does not exist,” i.e. there is no metalanguage
MONL.linkedContent: Heidegger says [?], “there is language that does not exist,” i.e. there is no metalanguage

R.content: democracy will never be present but it is urgent
R.linkedContent: democracy will never be present but it is urgent

R.content: to-come: democracy does not exist, never present, not because deferred but because aporetic in its structure  (force without force, incalculable singularity and calculable equality, commensurability and incommensurability, a despairing messianicity)
R.linkedContent: to-come: democracy does not exist, never present, not because deferred but because aporetic in its structure (force without force, incalculable singularity and calculable equality, commensurability and incommensurability, a despairing messianicity)

R.content: Schmitt is right, a pure sovereignty (decisionist exceptionality) is indivisible or not at all, it’s ahistorical, withdraws from language, does not exist
R.linkedContent: Schmitt is right, a pure sovereignty (decisionist exceptionality) is indivisible or not at all, it’s ahistorical, withdraws from language, does not exist

FK.content: khōra is nothing but not nothing in which anxiety of Dasein would still be open to question of Being > immemoriality of a desert
FK.linkedContent: khōra is nothing but not nothing in which anxiety of Dasein would still be open to question of Being > immemoriality of a desert

BL.content: law becomes something by being a nothing that constantly defers access to itself [tabernacle]; atopology [khōra] erases event, annuls the event, nullification gives birth to the law
BL.linkedContent: law becomes something by being a nothing that constantly defers access to itself [tabernacle]; atopology [khōra] erases event, annuls the event, nullification gives birth to the law

OOG.content: the Idea is not, always “beyond being” (epekeina tes ousias), as Telos of infinite determinability of Being, it’s being’s openness to the light > it is the light of light, sun of the visible sun, a hidden sun, no doubt what a Plato muted by Platonism tells us about
OOG.linkedContent: the Idea is not, always “beyond being” (epekeina tes ousias), as Telos of infinite determinability of Being, it’s being’s openness to the light > it is the light of light, sun of the visible sun, a hidden sun, no doubt what a Plato muted by Platonism tells us about

SPOM.content: there is no Dasein of the specter

POOF.content: democracy remains to come, this is its essence, indefinitely perfectible, always insufficient & future > even when there is democracy, it never exists
POOF.linkedContent: democracy remains to come, this is its essence, indefinitely perfectible, always insufficient & future > even when there is democracy, it never exists

HASD.content: [re: Mystical Theology] difference btwn access to contemplation of God, and access to where God resides > God not even in his most holy places, il n’est pas et il n’a pas lieu, ou plutôt il est et a lieu mais sans être et sans lieu, sans être sons lieu
HASD.linkedContent: [re: Mystical Theology] difference btwn access to contemplation of God, and access to where God resides > God not even in his most holy places, il n’est pas et il n’a pas lieu, ou plutôt il est et a lieu mais sans être et sans lieu, sans être sons lieu

MPM.content: if a past does not exist, no more does death—only mourning, figures of death, we inscribe in every trace (otherwise called “survivals”)—because they outlast us, trying their luck, in advance, “in memory of” [see p. 87n inexistence of past/death not futility/illusion]
MPM.linkedContent: if a past does not exist, no more does death—only mourning, figures of death, we inscribe in every trace (otherwise called “survivals”)—because they outlast us, trying their luck, in advance, “in memory of” [see p. 87n inexistence of past/death not futility/illusion]

MPM.content: for de Man, text defined by considering a statement at the same time performative & constative > this same time never is, will never have been, will never be present
MPM.linkedContent: for de Man, text defined by considering a statement at the same time performative & constative > this same time never is, will never have been, will never be present

EM.content: Being is nothing, not a being, cannot be said, cannot say itself, except in ontic metaphor
EM.linkedContent: Being is nothing, not a being, cannot be said, cannot say itself, except in ontic metaphor

PP.content: supplement is dangerous because it doesn’t exist (not a simple non-being, its sliding slips it out of alternative presence/absence)
PP.linkedContent: supplement is dangerous because it doesn’t exist (not a simple non-being, its sliding slips it out of alternative presence/absence)

PP.content: pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself

PP.content: no as such where writing or play are concerned, they cannot be classically affirmed (since they have no essence) w/out being negated, le jeu et la graphie vont sans cesse disparaissant
PP.linkedContent: no as such where writing or play are concerned, they cannot be classically affirmed (since they have no essence) w/out being negated, le jeu et la graphie vont sans cesse disparaissant

VP.content: “ideality is the salvation or mastery of presence in repetition” (this is why Husserl claims intuition is not reell), not a presence of anything that exists in the world, in correlation w/ ideal acts of repetition [idealization secured by a certain relation of “existent” to his death]
VP.linkedContent: “ideality is the salvation or mastery of presence in repetition” (this is why Husserl claims intuition is not reell), not a presence of anything that exists in the world, in correlation w/ ideal acts of repetition [idealization secured by a certain relation of “existent” to his death]

SH.content: date not there, w/ draws in order to appear, there are dates (just like there are ashes), even if they don’t exist
SH.linkedContent: date not there, w/ draws in order to appear, there are dates (just like there are ashes), even if they don’t exist

SH.content: date may always become no one’s, nothing’s date, the essence w/out essence of ash
SH.linkedContent: date may always become no one’s, nothing’s date, the essence w/out essence of ash

SH.content: a date, to become what it is, must give itself to be read in ash, in the nonbeing of its being
SH.linkedContent: a date, to become what it is, must give itself to be read in ash, in the nonbeing of its being

SH.content: [MOP] Celan: Aschenkelle (ash-ladle) draws from tub [better than manger/trough] of being, launders > soapy; ash uses up being, is not a being-that-remains, there is ash, but ash is not
SH.linkedContent: [MOP] Celan: Aschenkelle (ash-ladle) draws from tub [better than manger/trough] of being, launders > soapy; ash uses up being, is not a being-that-remains, there is ash, but ash is not

DS.content: necessity of folding (page of the hymen) not a secondary procedure, no smooth fold, hymen doesn’t simply adopt some fold > fold, in the lining which, of itself, the hymen was, at once its outside and its inside, no proper name, doesn’t exist: hymen, already torn, in the fold
DS.linkedContent: necessity of folding (page of the hymen) not a secondary procedure, no smooth fold, hymen doesn’t simply adopt some fold > fold, in the lining which, of itself, the hymen was, at once its outside and its inside, no proper name, doesn’t exist: hymen, already torn, in the fold

DS.content: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)
DS.linkedContent: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)

DS.content: si le texte à la lettre n’existe pas, there is (il y a), perhaps, a text, en marche, avec lequel il faut frayer
DS.linkedContent: si le texte à la lettre n’existe pas, there is (il y a), perhaps, a text, en marche, avec lequel il faut frayer

OS.content: nun, often translated as instant, functions in Greek like “now (maintenant)” > nun is form in which time cannot not be given, yet nun is not, is both no longer (n’est plus) & not yet (n’est pas encore), a no-thing (ne-ant), doesn’t participate in presence
OS.linkedContent: nun, often translated as instant, functions in Greek like “now (maintenant)” > nun is form in which time cannot not be given, yet nun is not, is both no longer (n’est plus) & not yet (n’est pas encore), a no-thing (ne-ant), doesn’t participate in presence

PS.content: Artaud: this hole of the hollow btwn 2 bellows of force/which were not (ce trou de creux entre deux soufflets de force/qui n’étaient pas)
PS.linkedContent: Artaud: this hole of the hollow btwn 2 bellows of force/which were not (ce trou de creux entre deux soufflets de force/qui n’étaient pas)

FS.content: for Blanchot, pure absence, the excess of everything—possibility of writing (absence of everything in which presence is announced) > makes one work
FS.linkedContent: for Blanchot, pure absence, the excess of everything—possibility of writing (absence of everything in which presence is announced) > makes one work

DIF.content: if differance is [Heidegger’s Durchstreichung of Being], it reserves itself, never offered to the present: exceeds order of truth, not a hole in topology of castration [p. 21 differance is not] [fixerup X]
DIF.linkedContent: if differance is [Heidegger’s Durchstreichung of Being], it reserves itself, never offered to the present: exceeds order of truth, not a hole in topology of castration [p. 21 differance is not] [fixerup X]

RGE.content: sovereignty is impossible—therefore it is not, it is “this loss (perte)”
RGE.linkedContent: sovereignty is impossible—therefore it is not, it is “this loss (perte)”

REST.content: certain thinking/experience of nothingness (nonexistent) is required to question being of existent, and the difference of being and existent
REST.linkedContent: certain thinking/experience of nothingness (nonexistent) is required to question being of existent, and the difference of being and existent

REST.content: for Heidegger, cette pensée du néant alien to science, which deals only w/ existents: belongs to philosophy/poetry > nonexistent, there w/out being there as being present, a kind of haunting: Unhemlichekeit is condition of question of being, pivot (cheville) of the essence (see OS)
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, cette pensée du néant alien to science, which deals only w/ existents: belongs to philosophy/poetry > nonexistent, there w/out being there as being present, a kind of haunting: Unhemlichekeit is condition of question of being, pivot (cheville) of the essence (see OS)

DST.content: for Lacoue-Labarthe, mimesis is an essence w/out essence, is not, does not exist—desists (not negative)
DST.linkedContent: for Lacoue-Labarthe, mimesis is an essence w/out essence, is not, does not exist—desists (not negative)

DST.content: ester: “to appear, present oneself in court” [p. 319n Kahn’s translation of Heidegger] > désistance, a rupture, heterogeneity w/ respect to Wesen, estance, not Abwesen (absence), Unwesen (disorder), Entwesen (inessentiality): dé, not negative, marks nonbelonging to family of ester
DST.linkedContent: ester: “to appear, present oneself in court” [p. 319n Kahn’s translation of Heidegger] > désistance, a rupture, heterogeneity w/ respect to Wesen, estance, not Abwesen (absence), Unwesen (disorder), Entwesen (inessentiality): dé, not negative, marks nonbelonging to family of ester

PIO.content: it is another “we” given over to inventiveness when mirror broken & tain crossed [re: “Fable”], a “we” that doesn’t find itself anywhere—not “we” of a community of human subjects
PIO.linkedContent: it is another “we” given over to inventiveness when mirror broken & tain crossed [re: “Fable”], a “we” that doesn’t find itself anywhere—not “we” of a community of human subjects

PIO.content: the other is always another origin of the world, and we are to be invented > beyond being
PIO.linkedContent: the other is always another origin of the world, and we are to be invented > beyond being

RM.content: quasi-metaphor of Being, since it is nothing, since its as obliterates its as such
RM.linkedContent: quasi-metaphor of Being, since it is nothing, since its as obliterates its as such

RM.content: Being, which is nothing: makes possible metaphoricity & its withdrawal
RM.linkedContent: Being, which is nothing: makes possible metaphoricity & its withdrawal

RM.content: can’t say trait is, it conditions the ontological copula—like es gibt
RM.linkedContent: can’t say trait is, it conditions the ontological copula—like es gibt

HLP.content: fabulous, phantasma, return of some specter: apparition of specter, vision of phantom, phenomenon of the revenant
HLP.linkedContent: fabulous, phantasma, return of some specter: apparition of specter, vision of phantom, phenomenon of the revenant

HLP.content: fable & phantasm do not belong to true or false
HLP.linkedContent: fable & phantasm do not belong to true or false

HLP.content: irreducible species of simulacrum, penumbral light of a virtuality, neither being nor nothingness (which no ontology/mimetology could account for, subdue w/ reason)
HLP.linkedContent: irreducible species of simulacrum, penumbral light of a virtuality, neither being nor nothingness (which no ontology/mimetology could account for, subdue w/ reason)

EJQB.content: the encounter (rencontre) is separation (breaks unity of Being by welcoming [accueillant] other into source of meaning) > contredit la “logique,” dans le fragile chaînon du “est”
EJQB.linkedContent: the encounter (rencontre) is separation (breaks unity of Being by welcoming [accueillant] other into source of meaning) > contredit la “logique,” dans le fragile chaînon du “est”

EJQB.content: only possible to say this by conceptualizing meaning, which is exile from Being, Being never is, never shows itself, never present, is never now
EJQB.linkedContent: only possible to say this by conceptualizing meaning, which is exile from Being, Being never is, never shows itself, never present, is never now

EJQB.content: Jew’s identification w/ himself doesn’t exist
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew’s identification w/ himself doesn’t exist

AFR.content: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself
AFR.linkedContent: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself

AFR.content: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself
AFR.linkedContent: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself

D.content: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves
D.linkedContent: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves

D.content: column is nothing, no meaning in itself, a hollow phallus > guarantees innumerable passage of dissemination and playful displacement of margins
D.linkedContent: column is nothing, no meaning in itself, a hollow phallus > guarantees innumerable passage of dissemination and playful displacement of margins

D.content: column is not, passage of dissemination, “phallic” significance of column is a semic effect, reflection on 4th surface (described center, represented mastery of dissemination); “is”—procures calm, consciousness of ideal mastery > operation of 4th surface
D.linkedContent: column is not, passage of dissemination, “phallic” significance of column is a semic effect, reflection on 4th surface (described center, represented mastery of dissemination); “is”—procures calm, consciousness of ideal mastery > operation of 4th surface

D.content: column has no being, belongs to no one
D.linkedContent: column has no being, belongs to no one

EL.content: Scholem’s nothing (secularization) occurs, not fortuitously analogous to Heidegger’s Was ist Metaphysik: nothingness, nothingness of language, announces “the essence of what it threatens and causes to recoil in totality”
EL.linkedContent: Scholem’s nothing (secularization) occurs, not fortuitously analogous to Heidegger’s Was ist Metaphysik: nothingness, nothingness of language, announces “the essence of what it threatens and causes to recoil in totality”

C.content: [re: 127 coffins] box is not, it remains, (a) mise en boîte (put in a box, make fun of itself)
C.linkedContent: [re: 127 coffins] box is not, it remains, (a) mise en boîte (put in a box, make fun of itself)

C.content: how can we delimit all the features (traits) [of artwork] when the absent one haunts, obsesses, besieges (assiège) [plus qu’un autre] > avec égale sans (trait d’union: with-out [in English])
C.linkedContent: how can we delimit all the features (traits) [of artwork] when the absent one haunts, obsesses, besieges (assiège) [plus qu’un autre] > avec égale sans (trait d’union: with-out [in English])

LI.content: why did Descartes have to prove the existence of God twice? ][3rd and 5th Meditations?] ——what does it mean to multiply/cite demonstrations/proofs of that beyond all substitution? God, exemplary case: unique, irreplaceable, both absolutely repeatable and unrepeatable
LI.linkedContent: why did Descartes have to prove the existence of God twice? ][3rd and 5th Meditations?] ——what does it mean to multiply/cite demonstrations/proofs of that beyond all substitution? God, exemplary case: unique, irreplaceable, both absolutely repeatable and unrepeatable

LI.content: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]
LI.linkedContent: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]

LI.content: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent
LI.linkedContent: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent

LI.content: in deconstructive practice, opposition conservative/revolutionary no longer pertinent > deconstruction is “inherently” nothing at all: only what it does, and what is done w/ it: depends on very minute, flexible analyses
LI.linkedContent: in deconstructive practice, opposition conservative/revolutionary no longer pertinent > deconstruction is “inherently” nothing at all: only what it does, and what is done w/ it: depends on very minute, flexible analyses

LI.content: differance as nonidentity w/ oneself in process of determination > differance is itself nothing outside of determination, never comes to a full stop (not negativity, nothingness)
LI.linkedContent: differance as nonidentity w/ oneself in process of determination > differance is itself nothing outside of determination, never comes to a full stop (not negativity, nothingness)

LI.content: though nothing exists outside context, limit of frame/border of context always entails nonclosure: outside penetrates, thus determines, inside
LI.linkedContent: though nothing exists outside context, limit of frame/border of context always entails nonclosure: outside penetrates, thus determines, inside

TN.content: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”
TN.linkedContent: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”

TN.content: limit, border (bord), which are nothing, make any gift possible
TN.linkedContent: limit, border (bord), which are nothing, make any gift possible

NOY.content: yes must be fictive, quasi, opens every event w/out being itself an event, never present
NOY.linkedContent: yes must be fictive, quasi, opens every event w/out being itself an event, never present

AD.content: for Levinas, God is not, not “contaminated by being”
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, God is not, not “contaminated by being”

AD.content: experience of à-Dieu: to have welcomed yes of other, infinity in separation, in its holiness > Adieu does not wait, is not, beyond being
AD.linkedContent: experience of à-Dieu: to have welcomed yes of other, infinity in separation, in its holiness > Adieu does not wait, is not, beyond being

WOG.content: khōra, utterly resistant to historical narrative, not eternal or ahistorical like intelligible idea > radically foreign to all oppositions & heterogenous to epekeina tēs ousias (the one that doesn’t participate in Being, gives rise to history, narratives, myths, Good and God)
WOG.linkedContent: khōra, utterly resistant to historical narrative, not eternal or ahistorical like intelligible idea > radically foreign to all oppositions & heterogenous to epekeina tēs ousias (the one that doesn’t participate in Being, gives rise to history, narratives, myths, Good and God)

CIN.content: cinder remains, cinder there is, nonbeing, nonpresence
CIN.linkedContent: cinder remains, cinder there is, nonbeing, nonpresence

CIN.content: holocaust as gift before every determinable being [see CIN in FIRE]
CIN.linkedContent: holocaust as gift before every determinable being [see CIN in FIRE]

CIN.content: cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing
CIN.linkedContent: cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing

BSi.content: to think the marionette, difference btwn marionettes, not the living of life but a living w/out being—simulacrum of being, prosthesis, substitute for the being of the thing itself—fetish—life death at same time > marionette [Marion’s Dieu sans l’Être]
BSi.linkedContent: to think the marionette, difference btwn marionettes, not the living of life but a living w/out being—simulacrum of being, prosthesis, substitute for the being of the thing itself—fetish—life death at same time > marionette [Marion’s Dieu sans l’Être]

BSi.content: Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything
BSi.linkedContent: Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything

OG.content: for Malebranche, original sin is distraction, inattention, is nothing, temptation of ease [MOP in attentiveness]
OG.linkedContent: for Malebranche, original sin is distraction, inattention, is nothing, temptation of ease [MOP in attentiveness]

OG.content: in the “unmotivatedness” of the sign, le tout autre s’annonce comme tel, the trace: “non-living,” occultation (de soi), prior to theology, dissimulates itself, no identity, no simplicity, resemblance, continuity > mark of relation to other, immotivation of trace has always become
OG.linkedContent: in the “unmotivatedness” of the sign, le tout autre s’annonce comme tel, the trace: “non-living,” occultation (de soi), prior to theology, dissimulates itself, no identity, no simplicity, resemblance, continuity > mark of relation to other, immotivation of trace has always become

OG.content: arche-writing can never be an object of science, it is that which cannot be reduced to a form of presence
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing can never be an object of science, it is that which cannot be reduced to a form of presence

OG.content: differance does not exist, the never being-present outside plenitude > no science of this nonorigin
OG.linkedContent: differance does not exist, the never being-present outside plenitude > no science of this nonorigin

OG.content: exclusion of the supplement, of addition, can only function if one deems it pure [i.e. simple exteriority, pure addition] > for logocentric MOP addition is nothing, can’t add to full presence (being, essence, eidos, ousia)
OG.linkedContent: exclusion of the supplement, of addition, can only function if one deems it pure [i.e. simple exteriority, pure addition] > for logocentric MOP addition is nothing, can’t add to full presence (being, essence, eidos, ousia)

OG.content: originary differance is supplementarity as structure: irreducible complexity of shifting play of absence/presence: metaphysics produced by it, doesn’t think it: writing is a representation of trace, trace itself does not exist > place of decision now hidden, but still indicated
OG.linkedContent: originary differance is supplementarity as structure: irreducible complexity of shifting play of absence/presence: metaphysics produced by it, doesn’t think it: writing is a representation of trace, trace itself does not exist > place of decision now hidden, but still indicated

OG.content: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)
OG.linkedContent: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)

UWC.content: university w/out conditions does not, in fact, exist > still, in principle, it remains ultimate place of critical resistance to dogmatism, unjust appropriation
UWC.linkedContent: university w/out conditions does not, in fact, exist > still, in principle, it remains ultimate place of critical resistance to dogmatism, unjust appropriation

EU.content: performativity (where knowledge & power are no longer distinguished) produces/transforms situation in which it speaks [i.e. the founding of a graduate school] > the performative does not exist
EU.linkedContent: performativity (where knowledge & power are no longer distinguished) produces/transforms situation in which it speaks [i.e. the founding of a graduate school] > the performative does not exist

CHOR.content: hymen: 1) membranous fold 2) marriage > lies btwn inside/outside of woman, btwn desire & its fulfillment: once pierced there is no hymen
CHOR.linkedContent: hymen: 1) membranous fold 2) marriage > lies btwn inside/outside of woman, btwn desire & its fulfillment: once pierced there is no hymen

CHOR.content: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
CHOR.linkedContent: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
